Subgroups.Name: acr
Subgroups.Description: Manage private registries with Azure Container Registries.

Subgroups.Name: ad
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Active Directory Graph entities needed for Role Based Access Control.

Subgroups.Name: cache
Subgroups.Description: Commands to manage CLI objects cached using the `--defer` argument.

Subgroups.Name: cosmosdb
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Cosmos DB database accounts.

Subgroups.Name: deployment
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Resource Manager deployments at subscription scope.

Subgroups.Name: deploymentmanager
Subgroups.Description: Create and manage rollouts for your service.

Subgroups.Name: dla
Subgroups.Description: Manage Data Lake Analytics accounts, jobs, and catalogs.

Subgroups.Name: dls
Subgroups.Description: Manage Data Lake Store accounts and filesystems.

Subgroups.Name: dms
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Data Migration Service (DMS) instances.

Subgroups.Name: eventgrid
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Event Grid topics, event subscriptions, domains and domain topics.

Subgroups.Name: eventhubs
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Event Hubs namespaces, eventhubs, consumergroups and geo recovery configurations - Alias.

Subgroups.Name: functionapp
Subgroups.Description: Manage function apps. To install the Azure Functions Core tools see https://github.com/Azure/azure-functions-core-tools.

Subgroups.Name: group
Subgroups.Description: Manage resource groups and template deployments.

Subgroups.Name: keyvault
Subgroups.Description: Manage KeyVault keys, secrets, and certificates.

Subgroups.Name: managedapp
Subgroups.Description: Manage template solutions provided and maintained by Independent Software Vendors (ISVs).

Subgroups.Name: managedservices
Subgroups.Description: Manage the registration assignments and definitions in Azure.

Subgroups.Name: mariadb
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Database for MariaDB servers.

Subgroups.Name: mysql
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Database for MySQL servers.

Subgroups.Name: openshift
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Red Hat OpenShift Services.

Subgroups.Name: postgres
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Database for PostgreSQL servers.

Subgroups.Name: redis
Subgroups.Description: Manage dedicated Redis caches for your Azure applications.

Subgroups.Name: relay
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Relay Service namespaces, WCF relays, hybrid connections, and rules.

Subgroups.Name: role
Subgroups.Description: Manage user roles for access control with Azure Active Directory and service principals.

Subgroups.Name: search
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Search services, admin keys and query keys.

Subgroups.Name: security
Subgroups.Description: Manage your security posture with Azure Security Center.

Subgroups.Name: servicebus
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure Service Bus namespaces, queues, topics, subscriptions, rules and geo-disaster recovery configuration alias.

Subgroups.Name: sf
Subgroups.Description: Manage and administer Azure Service Fabric clusters.

Subgroups.Name: snapshot
Subgroups.Description: Manage point-in-time copies of managed disks, native blobs, or other snapshots.

Subgroups.Name: sql
Subgroups.Description: Manage Azure SQL Databases and Data Warehouses.

Subgroups.Name: vm
Subgroups.Description: Manage Linux or Windows virtual machines.

Subgroups.Name: vmss
Subgroups.Description: Manage groupings of virtual machines in an Azure Virtual Machine Scale Set (VMSS).

Commands.Name: configure
Commands.ShortDescription: Manage Azure CLI configuration. This command is interactive.

Arguments.Name: --defaults
Arguments.Description: Space-separated 'name=value' pairs for common argument defaults.

Arguments.Name: --list-defaults
Arguments.Description: List all applicable defaults.  Allowed values: false, true.

Arguments.Name: --scope
Arguments.Description: Scope of defaults. Using "local" for settings only effective under current folder.  Allowed values: global, local.  Default: global.

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv, yaml. Default: json.

Arguments.Name: --query
Arguments.Description: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.

Examples.Description: Set default resource group, webapp and VM names.
Clear default webapp and VM names.

Commands.Name: feedback
Commands.ShortDescription: Send feedback to the Azure CLI Team!

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv, yaml.  Default: json.

Arguments.Name: --query
Arguments.Description: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.

Commands.Name: find
Commands.ShortDescription: I'm an AI robot, my advice is based on our Azure documentation as well as the usage patterns of Azure CLI and Azure ARM users. Using me improves Azure products and documentation.

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv, yaml.  Default: json.

Arguments.Name: --query
Arguments.Description: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.

Examples.Description: Give me any Azure CLI group and IÆll show the most popular commands within the group.
Give me any Azure CLI command and IÆll show the most popular parameters and subcommands.
You can also enter a search term, and I'll try to help find the best commands.

Commands.Name: interactive
Commands.ShortDescription: Start interactive mode. Installs the Interactive extension if not installed already.

Arguments.Name: --style
Arguments.Description: The colors of the shell.  Allowed values: bg, br, contrast, default, grey, halloween, neon, none, pastel, primary, purple, quiet.

Arguments.Name: --update
Arguments.Description: Update the Interactive extension to the latest available.

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv, yaml.  Default: json.

Arguments.Name: --query
Arguments.Description: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --allow-no-subscriptions
Arguments.Description: Support access tenants without subscriptions. It's uncommon but useful to run tenant level commands, such as 'az ad'.

Arguments.Name: --password
Arguments.Description: Credentials like user password, or for a service principal, provide client secret or a pem file with key and public certificate. Will prompt if not given.

Arguments.Name: --service-principal
Arguments.Description: The credential representing a service principal.

Arguments.Name: --tenant
Arguments.Description: The AAD tenant, must provide when using service principals.

Arguments.Name: --use-cert-sn-issuer
Arguments.Description: Used with a service principal configured with Subject Name and Issuer Authentication in order to support automatic certificate rolls.

Arguments.Name: --use-device-code
Arguments.Description: Use CLI's old authentication flow based on device code. CLI will also use this if it can't launch a browser in your behalf, e.g. in remote SSH or Cloud Shell.

Arguments.Name: --username
Arguments.Description: User name, service principal, or managed service identity ID.

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv, yaml. Default: json.

Arguments.Name: --query
Arguments.Description: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.

Examples.Description: Log in with user name and password. This doesn't work with Microsoft accounts or accounts that have two-factor authentication enabled.
Log in with a service principal using client secret.
Log in with a service principal using client certificate.
Log in using a VM's system assigned identity
Log in using a VM's user assigned identity. Client or object ids of the service identity also work

Commands.Name: logout
Commands.ShortDescription: Log out to remove access to Azure subscriptions.

Arguments.Name: --username
Arguments.Description: Account user, if missing, logout the current active account.

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv, yaml.  Default: json.

Arguments.Name: --query
Arguments.Description: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --method
Arguments.Description: HTTP request method.  Allowed values: delete, get, head, options, patch, post, put.  Default: get.

Arguments.Name: --uri
Arguments.Description: Request uri. For uri without host, CLI will assume "https://management.azure.com/". Common token '{subscriptionId}' will be replaced with the current subscription ID specified by 'az account set'.

Arguments.Name: --body
Arguments.Description: Request body. Use @{file} to load from a file.

Arguments.Name: --headers
Arguments.Description: Space-separated headers in KEY=VALUE format or JSON string. Use @{file} to load from a file.

Arguments.Name: --output-file
Arguments.Description: Save response payload to a file.

Arguments.Name: --resource
Arguments.Description: Resource url for which CLI should acquire a token in order to access the service. The token will be placed in the "Authorization" header. By default, CLI can figure this out based on "--url" argument, unless you use ones not in the list of "az cloud show --query endpoints".

Arguments.Name: --skip-authorization-header
Arguments.Description: Do not auto append "Authorization" header.

Arguments.Name: --uri-parameters
Arguments.Description: Space-separated queries in KEY=VALUE format or JSON string. Use @{file} to load from a file.

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit.

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format.  Allowed values: json, jsonc, none, table, tsv, yaml.  Default: json.

Arguments.Name: --query
Arguments.Description: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

Arguments.Name: --subscription
Arguments.Description: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.

Examples.Description: Get Audit log through Microsoft Graph
Update a Azure Active Directory Graph User's display name
Create a public IP address from body.json file
